def.socket_io.socketio

Class Adapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • def.js.Object
      • def.socket_io.socketio.Adapter

  • @Interface
public abstract class Adapter
extends def.js.Object
    The interface used when dealing with rooms etc

    • Nested Class Summary

      This is an automatically generated object type (see the source definition).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Namespace nsp
      The namespace that this adapter is for
      Adapter.Rooms rooms
      A dictionary of all the rooms that we have in this namespace The rooms are made of a `sockets` key which is the dictionary of sockets per ID
      Adapter.Sids sids
      A dictionary of all the socket ids that we're dealing with, and all the rooms that the socket is currently in

    • Field Detail

      • nsp

        public Namespace nsp
        The namespace that this adapter is for

      • rooms

        public Adapter.Rooms rooms
        A dictionary of all the rooms that we have in this namespace The rooms are made of a `sockets` key which is the dictionary of sockets per ID

      • sids

        public Adapter.Sids sids
        A dictionary of all the socket ids that we're dealing with, and all the rooms that the socket is currently in

    • Constructor Detail

      • Adapter

        public Adapter()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(String id,
                String room,
                Consumer<Object> callback)
        Adds a socket to a room. If the room doesn't exist, it's created
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the socket to add
        room - The name of the room to add the socket to
        callback - An optional callback to call when the socket has been added. It should take an optional parameter, error, if there was a problem

      • del

        public void del(String id,
                String room,
                Consumer<Object> callback)
        Removes a socket from a room. If there are no more sockets in the room, the room is deleted
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the socket that we're removing
        room - The name of the room to remove the socket from
        callback - An optional callback to call when the socket has been removed. It should take on optional parameter, error, if there was a problem

      • delAll

        public void delAll(String id)
        Removes a socket from all the rooms that it's joined
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the socket that we're removing

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(Object packet,
                      Adapter.Opts opts)
        Broadcasts a packet
        Parameters:
        packet - The packet to broadcast
        opts - Any options to send along: - rooms: An optional list of rooms to broadcast to. If empty, the packet is broadcast to all sockets - except: A list of Socket IDs to exclude - flags: Any flags that we want to send along ('json', 'volatile', 'broadcast')

      • add

        public void add(String id,
                String room)
        Adds a socket to a room. If the room doesn't exist, it's created
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the socket to add
        room - The name of the room to add the socket to
        callback - An optional callback to call when the socket has been added. It should take an optional parameter, error, if there was a problem

      • del

        public void del(String id,
                String room)
        Removes a socket from a room. If there are no more sockets in the room, the room is deleted
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the socket that we're removing
        room - The name of the room to remove the socket from
        callback - An optional callback to call when the socket has been removed. It should take on optional parameter, error, if there was a problem

        callback - An optional callback to call when the socket has been added. It should take an optional parameter, error, if there was a problem
